name: A Grand Design
description:
A Grand Design is a simple machine editor made for the olcCodeJam 2020
If you ever wanted to try to make simple machines, this game/app is for you

At the moment, the app consists of the following units:
- Static unit (Its forms the structure of machines)

 - Propeller unit (Its gives motion to the machines)

- Reverser unit (It reverses the direction of machines)

 - Wall unit (Its a breakable wall)

- Gravity unit (It provides gravity to the machines)

 - Generator unit (It generates the unit under it)

  • In order to connect a propeller to a static unit, the propeller must be exactly 1 unit under the static unit
  • Static units can connect to already connected static units
  • If static units don't appear on play, it means that the static units are either not connected or they're too many units for a propeller to support (Try placing more propellers to fix this)
  • Gravity units must be placed on top of static units only (Note: Gravity unit and reverser unit don't work properly together)

To allow more user-interactivity, you can move your machines using the arrow keys or WASD keys. Use the Left Mouse Button to place a unit after selecting a unit from the left and to also select color from the right and the Right Mouse Button to remove a unit

I used the olc::PixelGameEngine for this project
All art was done by me (except for the color spectrum)

The source for this project is in my Github A Grand Design Source

I'd appreciate all the feedback I can get
Thanks
